Something happened today and we stopped billing accurately on one of our call accounts, can you look into this?

http://www.screencast.com/t/lut926m4

If  &ta=1  AND &ta=2   in phone query GET parameters then
Revenue share = 1  (Fixed)
means bid value = bid value x 1

Else if &ta not given in phone query then 
Revenue share = 0.6 (Take Publisher revenue share, if not use Default 0.6)
means bid value = bid value x 0.6
80 x 0.6 = 48

This logic is written in Phone Query server code.

We publish the bid value in query feed, i.e
bid value = max ppc x revenue share

content: Disable Campaigns growth due to Bulk-upload

comments.content:
In current Bulk upload, some users insert campaigns regularly and make the older campaigns disable. Instead of update campaign they insert a new campaign. Because of this we have around 10K campaign insertion every day.  Now the disable campaign count reaches to 3M in Adpad system.

Since campaigns have status disable so it is difficult to delete them, need some proper logic that we were establishing in account cleanup project.

Possible solutions for this problem are.
1- Educate the user to use bulk update.
2- If update is not possible then introduce a delete option in bulk upload that mark the campaign status = delete. So we can easily clean them afterwards.
3- Introduce account clean-up project, though we are busy in some other important projects, so it is not feasible at once.

We need to discuss these possibilities and make a plan to tackle it.
Account cleanup is the way we are going to tackle these...we do educate the users, but can't force them to do it right :/
closing it as nothing to do on it.

Guys, one of our clients that spends big money has noticed that he gets slow spend at the beginning of the hour for a few minutes (not much of a concern) but depending on the hour could see no spend for 10 - 15 minutes at the end of the hour.  (see the attached graph for account ID: 18951 on 11/09/2015 during the 12:00pm hour).

Some hours look better, others look worse.  Is there anything we can do to smooth that out a bit more?

"no spend for 10 - 15 minutes at the end of the hour"

It is because the hour limit already reached. In current pacing logic there is hourly limit and once the limit achieved then pacing stops the query feed to avoid over serving. 

Inside an hour, the pacing v2 (Allen code logic) is running. For tuning of Allen code, we introduce adaptive ramp-up parameters, so that every type of campaign can adjust. So for more tuning we need to adjust the parameters. But the above hour graph shows good results as we can not adjust the ramp up factors more accurate as our pacing update time is 15 secs.  

If we increase the ramp up parameters then no spend time increases, if we decrease the ramp up parameters then less spending in hour.

My question is: how this is harming the user? does he want to spend more money and think that it is not possible as some minutes in hour has no spending?

He is trying to keep his spend consistent throughout the hour and not have 10 or 15 minutes where it is not getting traffic.

So if this is something that would hurt others, I would leave it the way it is as it works VERY well for everyone else :)

OK, we will stay with current pacing logic.

Closing this task.

Rich,

According to internet standards, characters used in any URL should be and mostly are in lower case.  Or if you are using upper case in the URL then your page script should be case insensitive for those values.

Like pages

http://www.abc.com/myPage.php and http://www.abc.com/mypage.php

OR 

http://www.abc.com/myPage.php?name=noman and http://www.abc.com/myPage.php?NAME=noman 

must be treated as same. 

This is because because most of the time user writes URL without considering character case. So it becomes easy to follow this lower case logic.

Initially we didn't had this logic but later on customer user experiance we put this and its working fine from quite a while.

Temporary solution would be by adding a button besides the text box, labeling something like "CHANGE TO LOWER CASE". So case will only change if that button is clicked otherwise no case conversion will occur. We also have to make changes in bulk to maintain case of clickURL as well. But still I don't think it would be the solution because we might get more customer complaints against this in future. 

Best solution would be if they do changes on their own page to make the script case-insensitive for the URL input parameters.

Thoughts......?

Noman, the best solution for their click URL would be for us to maintain the case they use.  The issue they are having is:

http://www.contv.com/detail-movie/CEG10011614/vamp/?utm_source=CreepConSiteSchedule&utm_medium=LinkVamp&utm_campaign=CreepCon?utm_source=X&utm_medium=referral&utm_campign=XP_SOS2

In this url "CEG10011614" is referring to a directory on their server and in most servers (such as linux) directory's are case sensitive.

It's true that in the URL "www.contv.com" does not matter, but anything after that should maintain the case.

Can we fix that?

Ok Rich, we are removing case conversion for click URL in adlisting and keyword update forms to maintain case sensitivity.  Following interfaces will be updated.

  1. adpad-ui
  2. bulkupload
  3. Rest API
Started working on this.

On 15 Aug 2015 we have seen that database down for some time and after it went up the back ground click processing service (bg_clickprocessor.pl) did not work properly and it was in stall state. Due to that huge amount of click stayed in the apxml06 server in files and insertion in database process stalled.  Due to this all financial accounting processes and pacing did not update and cost us huge over serve.

We need to tackle the following things.
  1. Make sure the service never stuck in any state. Need to handle database connection in all sort of scenarios.
  2. Make this service fast, insertion rate should be around 200 clicks per second. Currently it is 20 clicks per second.

We are doing a short fix to protect the system from over serving. 
There will be a service that will monitor the click files count and if the count exceeds 5000 (or any threshold) then it will send a flag file to all query servers indicating query feed stop and also shoot a alert mail. Vise versa if count become less then it will send query start feed flag file. 

Later on we will work on the service architect to change it for high click traffic.
Sounds good.

Kamran, I think have to tweak this parameter whenever there is a change in traffic. I suggest our strategy should be to code once rather than coming back again and again to the same code for tweaking the parameters. 

Following is my suggestion.

Components:

db status manager: Service listening on click server and getting status from local machine.

Status query service: bg script running on all query servers making hits with a predefined interval (let say 5 seconds) to click server to get db status. if response is false or there is no response or unable to connect to click server it will immediately stop the query feed.

Patch in clickprocessing.pl: it will create error flag file on the same machine if certain number of db retries are failed. This file will be checked by db status manager if exists then manager will assume that db connection is down and will respond in false.

The Flow:
1) Status query service from query server will send a socket call to db status manager.

2) db status manager will check current system if the clickprocessing.pl running & there is no db error flag file exists then it will return response in OK otherwise in FAILED.

3) if Status query service gets OK response it will do nothing while if it gets FAILED response it will immediately stop query feed. 

Thoughts?
If above is not possible quickly then you can go with your solution but the wc count limit should accommodate if there is change in daily traffic.

On Saturday - Campaign not in listing dump.

This user is changing the campaign regularly.

Ok, this is odd.  Ok, let me ask you this.  How did could this happen:

This is invalid string.
<ca_geostates>Quebec</ca_geostates>

Canada states should be two character. Like that
<ca_geostates>QC</ca_geostate>

CID: 2729418  that has this issue is not appearing today in listing files nor in pacing file. 

We have seen in database, the campaign status is disabled.

Though if want  to fix it, we need to check from where this data entry happened ( UI, BULK or REST api).  

I am stating that string should be like that and forward it to Amin to check further the data entry point. 

though for many other users, this Quebec issue not exist as most of them just uses the country filter CA only.

Noman has fixed the campaign CID: 2729418  geo file manually from backend.

<ca_geostates>Quebec</ca_geostates>
to 
<ca_geostates>QC</ca_geostate>
I will see it tomorrow to check further the data entry point.

Ok, thanks.  Can you double check to make sure all of the Canadian campaigns in the system look good moving forward?

I am glad that Kamran fixed it...but do we know why it happened in the first place?  and have we seen that happen since?
C/C++ Team, I have created data as per request locally. Please update on findings after analysis.

okay we have observed that if user provides "ca-states[Quebec]" through Bulk OR API then we will have invalid string:
<ca_geostates>Quebec</ca_geostates>
Ok, then can we add that to the bug list and get that corrected?

okay, creating another to do for this task.
For now this to do is good to be closed .... Correct?
correct :)

Guys, the phone reports are not generating.  Here is a video that shows what we are seeing:

http://www.screencast.com/t/jQwUaP1MabO

We need this fixed as soon as possible.

Thank you.
Ok we are looking into it.
Started working on this.
Any ETA on this?
Any updates?

Bug fixed.
Consumed Time: 5 hours
Issue has been fixed. Over to you QC.
Testing started.
• okay, report is now showing. Attached screenshot for what I just generated.
Looks good. Thanks!

Look like we have an issue.  if a call comes in, and doesn't bill, but then calls back and it should bill, we are still not billing the call.

Here is an example:

marketing3@rightonmobile.com

CID: 2529253

Date Range: Today  (7/8/2015)

Billing on 30 sec duration

http://screencast.com/t/vBDBJZeGnzoh

http://screencast.com/t/DeCx8mOdZ


Can we fix this?
Let me check that

Actually, when these calls came first they were having connect_duration = 0 that's whey they became un-billed.

In second turn connect duration is greater than billable duration BUT call_result_description_detail tag contained word REPEAT that is why call became un-billed.

We make billed call un-billed if call_result_description_detail tag contains word REPEAT.

Oh, then we need to work out the logic ourselves that in a call comes in with the same number and was already billed then don't bill it again.

If another call comes in with the same number before that has not already been billed, then bill it if it meets the duration.

Is that doable?
Ok, what should we do with the filter that is based on the REPEAT word in call_result_description_detail tag. I mean what would be the priority?

After careful inspection, the current logic is correct, so NO changes are needed.

I will close this out for now.

Thanks!

content: Invoicing Issue when paying by CC.

comments.content:
The AdPad invoicing process is showing an error message that doesn’t seem to be accurate:


“You are not allowed to pay over invoiced amt”


This is on username: api-reply@ezanga.com


It's a credit account and we tried to pay by credit card and got this error.


We need to get this fixed.  Thanks.
okay we are looking at this.

If invoice is enabled then first user has to pay loan amount in order to clear his loan. Once done then he can do another transaction in order to add more balance to the account.

We are digging out more in the issue.
Started working on this.

Just an update: We are working on this issue. Looks like system stores invoice amount even if user pays back before system sends Invoice email.
But this is a thought and we will fix it tomorrow.
ok, i know it is confusing, but want to make sure we get this working...thanks.

Fix completed.
Consumed Time: 9 hours

Rich, this issue has been resolved.

During the fix we've also observed that if complete payment is not made in the due month and next month comes and another invoice generated for the 2nd month then the remaining partial payment for the 1st month could be skipped if a partial payment is made for 2nd month. One has to do adjustments in order to adjust accounts.

I understand... we never really built out a full invoicing system, and that is something we should work to fix, but for now, this will be fine.

Thanks.

content: Ad title showing error message which is confusing

comments.content:
Ad title showing error message which is confusing:

We need to change error message style appearing on 'Ad Title' and 'Visible url'.

 

Current Funcionality:

On campaign wizard, when user inputs more than 100 characters on adlisting then system shows an alert.

"You have achieved maximum characters limit (100)."

This message appears on exact 100 characters which user inputs. Message should show greater than 100 characters.

 

Proposed Functionality:

On campaign wizard, user should get error messages just like we have for other fields like 'campaign Name'. On form submit we show error message and when user clears the problem then system just submits the form. 

 

We are to change this on following:

 

Campaign wizard

Create New Ad

Update Ad
